body.p:
To His Excellency. Hon Jas F Robinson
Governor of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Lyon Caldwell and Crittenden Counties would state that at the June Term 1861 of Caldwell Circuit Court Theophilus Cooking (now a citizen of Lyon Co) was tried upon an indictment for Assault and Battery and upon conviction was fined the sum of Fifty Dollars. Now without impugning the notions or action of either the Court of Jury that tried him, we would state that in our opinions the verd the punishment thus inflicted was severe, And in view of the fact that Mr Cooksey is very old and infirm and almost helpless. (being Seventy-Six years of age and suffering greatly from Bodily affliction) and quite poor and consiquently standing greatly in need of means to support him in ^this^ his time & hour of affliction, ^& old age^ We would and his diseased bodily condition being partly induced by wounds received in defense of our nationality in the war of 1812 at the seige of Fort Erie
We ask as a favor to him in his present condition that said fine be by your Excellency his case receive at your hands such Executive Clemency as will save him from want
Believing ^too^ that by a remission of said fine the state will not be wronged
